info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, northwestern Albany, northeastern Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 317 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fonda, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Rotterdam, Scotia, Guilderland, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Voorheesville, Altamont, Delanson, East Glenville, New Scotland, Knox, Glen, Princetown, Charleston, Esperance, Duane, Rockwell Corners, Harding Crossing and Gifford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
